casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Pete PEREZ, III, Defendant-Appellant. No. 09-16167

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. July 9, 2010. Terry Flynn, U.S. Attorney’s Office, N.D. of Florida, Tallahassee, FL, E. Bryan Wilson, Tallahassee, FL, for Plaintiff-Ap-pellee. Randolph P. Murrell, Federal Public Defender, Tallahassee, FL, Charles William Lammers, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Tallahassee, FL, Gwendolyn L. Spi-vey, Federal Defender Office, Tallahassee, FL, for DefendanL-Appellant. Before EDMONDSON, CARNES and ANDERSON, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:

Gwendolyn Spivey, appointed counsel for Pete Perez, III, in this direct criminal appeal, has moved to withdraw from further representation of the appellant and filed a brief pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Our independent review of the entire record reveals that counsel’s assessment of the relative merit of the appeal is correct. Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s *877motion to withdraw is GRANTED, and Perez’s convictions and sentences are AFFIRMED.
